result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah R Vargas

defendant.name: Vargas, Elijah R
defendant.address: 5840 West Madison Street, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elijah R Vargas in court.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Elijah R Vargas.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Parties are continuing negotiations. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 089251,
Payable Number: 1033010,
Receipt Number: 22RP037534,
Amount: $20.00
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Elijah R Vargas in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant was referred to the State Public Defender's Office and was determined ineligible for public defender representation. 
Court did not appoint an attorney. Case adjourned to allow time for defendant to retain private attorney.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders  bail to be returned to the person who posted.

Defendant Elijah R Vargas in court.    Josh Kather, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/10/2022@2:30pm
